title: Ryanair says has never made an approach for Norwegian Air
text:
May 24, 2018 / 1:40 PM / Updated 11 minutes ago Ryanair says has never made an approach for Norwegian Air Reuters Staff 1 Min Read
DUBLIN (Reuters) - Ryanair ( RYA.I ) has never made an approach for Norwegian Air ( NWC.OL ) and does not intend to, the Irish airline said on Thursday, disputing claims made by the chief executive of its rival budget carrier. FILE PHOTO: A Ryanair Boeing 737-800 plane taxis at Lisbon's airport, Portugal April 24, 2018. REUTERS/Rafael Marchante/File Photo
Ryanair last year approached Norwegian Air with a proposal to take a stake of around 20 percent in the Oslo-listed carrier, a source with close knowledge of the discussion told Reuters on Thursday.
Norwegian Air Chief Executive Bjoern Kjos confirmed there had been contact between the companies and he brought it up with the board, but declined to discuss any details.
“There is no truth to these claims. We have not made an approach to Norwegian and we have no interest,” Ryanair said in an emailed statement. Reporting by Padraic Halpin; Editing by Alexandra Hudson
